titleStmt.title: Patrick Carroll to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5092

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Ky.

Your petitioner respectfully represents that at the last February Term of the Fayette Circuit Court Charles Jenkins who is a worthless character, had him indicted for keeping a tippling house for three months and as he is informed and believes said indictment was procured in consequence of the refusal of petitioner to give him the said witness, whiskey and other liquors which he was regularly licensed to sell without any compensation. Knowing the vindictive spirit actuating the said witness your petitioner by the advice of his counsel confessed Judgment for simply keeping a tippling house and now in consideration of the foregoing facts and the positive assurance of your petitioner that he is entirely innocent of the charge, and that he has not at any time violated the law in any particular, he respectfully askes that Judgment shall as far as in your power, lies be remitted. By the Judgment Your petitioner is fined sixty dollars
and costs, He submits his petition to your Excellency
Sworn to before me W. A. Stivers a Notary Public in and for Fayette County Ky this 21st day of June 1864. Witness my hand & seal the day & year find above matter.

figure.ab:
NOTARY PUBLIC
W. A. STIVERS
FAYETTE COUNTY, K.Y.

body.p: The undersigned respectfully unite in the prayer of the petitioner.

John O. Toole 65. Main st., Lex Ky.
Snaren T. Dillon
Bookman #6 Ky
W T Lee Lieut 16th Ky cal vol
Hugh Harley
P. W. Cannon
P F Maguire
G. F. Lilley
T M Bell for G K Bell
P. Bishop
Thos Hewron
Dan Kastle
Joseph Hoeing
Tho. C. Oscar
John T. Stiller
Geo B. Kinkead - without knowing what the evidence was
A S. Cooper
John McCauley
G. S. Morgan
John Rodger
Richard Owens
M. S. Keith
Z. Gibbons
G. Stoll Jr
Jas C. Morris
R. H. Prewitt
D C Wickliffe
